responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Potential command injection in `test-addons-ops.sh`
    analysis: |
      The script `test-addons-ops.sh` uses `pushd ${home}`. If the
      environment variable `$home` is controlled by an attacker, this enables
      executing arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - test_addons_ops
    filenames:
      - scripts/test-addons-ops.sh
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Potential command injection in `test-standard-ops.sh`
    analysis: |
      The script `test-standard-ops.sh` uses `pushd ${home}`. If the
      environment variable `$home` is controlled by an attacker, this enables
      executing arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - test_standard_ops
    filenames:
      - scripts/test-standard-ops.sh
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Potential command injection in `test-legacy-ops.sh`
    analysis: |
      The script `test-legacy-ops.sh` uses `pushd ${home}`. If the
      environment variable `$home` is controlled by an attacker, this enables
      executing arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - test_legacy_ops
    filenames:
      - scripts/test-legacy-ops.sh
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Potential command injection in `test-test-ops.sh`
    analysis: |
      The script `test-test-ops.sh` uses `pushd ${home}`. If the
      environment variable `$home` is controlled by an attacker, this enables
      executing arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - test_test_ops
    filenames:
      - scripts/test-test-ops.sh
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Potential command injection in `semantic-tests.sh`
    analysis: |
      The script `semantic-tests.sh` uses `pushd ${home}`. If the
      environment variable `$home` is controlled by an attacker, this enables
      executing arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - semantic_tests
    filenames:
      - scripts/semantic-tests.sh
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Potential command injection in `test-experimental-ops.sh`
    analysis: |
      The script `test-experimental-ops.sh` uses `pushd ${home}`. If the
      environment variable `$home` is controlled by an attacker, this enables
      executing arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - test_experimental_ops
    filenames:
      - scripts/test-experimental-ops.sh
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Potential command injection in test-addons-ops.sh
leads.analysis:
The script test-addons-ops.sh uses pushd ${home}. If the
environment variable $home is controlled by an attacker, this enables
executing arbitrary commands.
